SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.Actor.Boss

Class BossFirePattern

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Actor.Boss.BossFirePattern
public class BossFirePattern extends Object
The BossFirePattern class controls the firing patterns of the boss in the game. It handles the creation of projectiles for different attack types, such as straight, scatter, and directional shots.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    List<ActiveActorDestructible>
    createDirectionalProjectiles()
    Creates a directional shot of projectiles fired by the boss in multiple directions: straight, up-left, and down-left.

    Creates a scatter shot of projectiles fired by the boss, spread out vertically.

  • Field Details

    • PROJECTILE_Y_POSITION_OFFSET

      private static final double PROJECTILE_Y_POSITION_OFFSET
      The vertical offset for the spawn position of projectiles. Determines where the projectiles are fired relative to the boss's Y position.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • boss

      private final Boss boss
      The boss object that fires projectiles. This object is used to retrieve the current position of the boss for projectile creation.

  • Constructor Details

    • BossFirePattern

      public BossFirePattern(Boss boss)
      Constructs a BossFirePattern object that controls the firing patterns of the boss.
      Parameters:
      boss - The boss object that will fire projectiles.

  • Method Details

    • getBossXPosition

      private double getBossXPosition()
      Retrieves the current X position of the boss.
      Returns:
      The boss's current X position.

    • getBossYPosition

      private double getBossYPosition()
      Retrieves the current Y position of the boss.
      Returns:
      The boss's current Y position.

    • selectAttackType

      public int selectAttackType()
      Randomly selects an attack type for the boss. The attack types are: - 1 for straight shot - 2 for scatter shot - 3 for directional shot
      Returns:
      An integer representing the attack type (1, 2, or 3).

    • createStraightProjectile

      public List<ActiveActorDestructible> createStraightProjectile()
      Creates a straight line of projectiles fired by the boss.
      Returns:
      A list containing a single straight projectile.

    • createTwoProjectiles

      public List<ActiveActorDestructible> createTwoProjectiles()
      Creates two projectiles fired by the boss at slightly different vertical positions.
      Returns:
      A list containing two projectiles.

    • createScatterProjectiles

      public List<ActiveActorDestructible> createScatterProjectiles()
      Creates a scatter shot of projectiles fired by the boss, spread out vertically.
      Returns:
      A list of projectiles spread out vertically.

    • createDirectionalProjectiles

      public List<ActiveActorDestructible> createDirectionalProjectiles()
      Creates a directional shot of projectiles fired by the boss in multiple directions: straight, up-left, and down-left.
      Returns:
      A list of projectiles fired in three directions.
